summary:
Rugby union is a team sport that started in England in the 1800s. It's played with 15 players on each team, running with an oval ball on a rectangular field. The goal is to score points by touching the ball down in the opponent's area.

It's popular worldwide, with over 10 million players. The main governing body, World Rugby, has 116 full members. The sport became professional in 1995. International matches began in 1871, and big tournaments like the Rugby World Cup are held every four years. Many countries have their own national competitions, too.
title: Rugby union
